item.title: LA has ‘alarming’ virus surge past 100,000
item.description: Los Angeles County has recorded an "alarming" one-day spike of nearly 3000 new COVID-19 infections, taking its total to more than 100,000 cases, public health officials say, warning that hospitals could soon be overwhelmed.

item.title: China Muslim reports ‘disturbing’: Pompeo
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has labelled as "shocking" and "disturbing" reports that China's ruling Communist Party is using forced sterilisation, forced abortion and coercive family planning against minority Muslims.

item.title: US ‘Golden State Killer’ pleads guilty
item.description: An ex-policeman accused of being the "Golden State Killer" who terrorised much of California with a string of slayings, rapes and break-ins has pleaded guilty to multiple murder and kidnapping charges.

item.title: One shot dead at US Amazon facility
item.description: One person was killed and two others were injured in a targeted shooting outside an Amazon warehouse in Florida.

item.title: Man on run after fatal Sydney shooting
item.description: A 44-year-old man has died after being shot in the leg in a western Sydney home, with the shooter still on the run.

item.title: Melbourne community TV lives another year
item.description: Melbourne community TV station Channel 31 has been given a second lease on life, remaining on air for another year as it transitions to online broadcasting.

item.title: Copper rises as virus affects Chile supply
item.description: Supply disruption in top producer Chile, solid demand in top consumer China and dwindling stockpiles kept copper prices near five-month highs on Monday.

item.title: Iraqi releases Iran-backed militiamen
item.description: Iraqi government officials say a number of Iran-backed militiamen arrested in a raid by security forces on Thursday have been released on bail.

item.title: Some employers finding lack of applicants
item.description: More than half of employers struggling to find workers have blamed a lack of applicants, as the economy reopens.

item.title: Egypt hospital fire kills 7 virus patients
item.description: An Egyptian hospital's intensive care unit caught has fire, killing seven COVID-19 patients, according to the country's public prosecutor.
